alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Phelps and northwestern Harlan Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 318 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oxford, or 13 miles southwest of Holdrege, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Atlanta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
